thread.title: Mark McGhee set for Motherwell job
thread.title_full: Mark McGhee set for Motherwell job

title: Mark McGhee set for Motherwell job
text:
Mark McGhee set for Motherwell job 13 Oct 2015 09:17:03 
comments 
Mark McGhee is closing in on the manager's job at Motherwell, Press Association Sport understands. 
Scotland's assistant boss, 58, who managed the Fir Park club between 2007 and 2009 before leaving for Aberdeen, has held positive talks with the Well board. 
Stephen Craigan, who has been caretaker since Ian Baraclough departed the club last month, has pulled out of the running. 
The 38-year-old former Motherwell captain, who had been Well's under-20s coach, had two matches in charge, a 2-1 win over Partick Thistle and 2-1 defeat at Dundee. 
Ex-Motherwell player Simo Valakari had been considered but McGhee's experience looks to have proved crucial in the final part of the process. Related Sport News
